attributes.action: Stop Low Traffic Neighbourhood (LTN) schemes in London
attributes.additional_details:
Many side streets in London have been closed off to cars, thus causing people to drive via the main road.
Main roads are therefore a lot more congested than in the past, thus causing more time spent in traffic jams. 
Rather than driving directly home, we now need to take a longer route, which is unfair and irritating.
Due to having to drive via the main road, rather than taking short cuts, journeys are a lot longer and thus has a negative impact on the environment and on mental health.
attributes.background: Councils in London have introduced LTN's i.e. the closure of many side streets, in a bid to encourage walking and cycling and to reduce traffic. These schemes are instead causing disruption to citizens' everyday lives. Fining people for driving in roads they've always driven in is unjust.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council and Transport for London, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Impose stricter requirements on reallocation of road space by local authorities: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550887
